chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall p n q x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) (power p (q * n)) -> 1 <= n -> divides x (power p q)

Premises:
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
divides = fun a b : nat => exists q : nat, a = b * q : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
prime_power : forall p n x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) p -> divides x p
power_divides_power : forall x n m : nat, x > 1 -> divides (power x n) (power x m) -> m <= n
power_divides_lemma1 : forall n x : nat, 0 < n -> divides (power x n) x
prime_mult : forall p a b : nat, is_prime p -> divides (a * b) p -> divides a p \/ divides b p
prime_square : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> divides (square a) p -> divides a p
prime_div_gcd : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ divides a p -> rel_prime p a
prime_rel_prime : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ rel_prime a p -> divides a p
divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
power_power_lemma1 : forall n m x : nat, power (power x n) m = power x (n * m)
prime_gcd : forall d p a : nat, is_prime p -> is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p
power_power_rel_prime : forall a n b m : nat, n > 0 -> m > 0 -> rel_prime (power a n) (power b m) < -> rel_prime a b
power_lt : forall p m : nat, 1 < p -> 0 < m -> 1 < power p m
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, (0 <= n)%Z -> (n <= m)%Z -> (0 <= p)%Z -> (p <= q)%Z -> (n * p <= m * q)%Z
Pos2Z.inj_mul : forall p q : positive, Z.pos (p * q) = (Z.pos p * Z.pos q)%Z
rel_prime_power : forall d a n : nat, rel_prime a d -> rel_prime a (power d n)
mult_lt_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> n * p < m * p
power_rel_prime : forall d a n : nat, n > 0 -> rel_prime a (power d n) -> rel_prime a d
Nat.gauss : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n (m * p) -> Nat.gcd n m = 1 -> Nat.divide n p
Nat.lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m < p -> n < p
VectorDef.take : forall p : nat, p <= ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A p where ?A : [ |- Type] ?n : [ |- nat]
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists p : nat, y' = p * x')) (Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism...
Nat.divide_add_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n m -> Nat.divide n (m + p) -> Nat.divide n p
Nat.mul_sub_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n - m) * p = n * p - m * p
Nat.mul_add_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) * p = n * p + m * p
OMEGA8 : forall x y : Z, (0 <= x)%Z -> (0 <= y)%Z -> x = (- y)%Z -> x = 0%Z
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide_mul_l : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n m -> Nat.divide n (m * p)
Z.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : Z, (n < m)%Z -> (m <= p)%Z -> (n < p)%Z
OMEGA6 : forall x y z : Z, (0 <= x)%Z -> y = 0%Z -> (0 <= x + y * z)%Z
OMEGA2 : forall x y : Z, (0 <= x)%Z -> (0 <= y)%Z -> (0 <= x + y)%Z
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
Nat.mul_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n * (m * p) = n * m * p
power_zero : forall n x : nat, power x n = 0 -> x = 0
inj_eq : forall x y : nat, x = y -> Z.of_nat x = Z.of_nat y
non_div_1 : forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> ~ divides 1 a
Pos.mul_1_r : forall p : positive, (p * 1)%positive = p
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
divides_trans : forall a b c : nat, divides a b -> divides b c -> divides a c
gauss : forall d a b : nat, rel_prime a d -> divides (a * b) d -> divides b d

```coq
intros p n q x Hprime Hdiv Hn.
apply gauss with (a:=power x n).
- apply rel_prime_power with (n:=q*n) in Hprime. apply power_rel_prime.
  + apply Nat.lt_0_succ.
  + exact Hprime.
- apply divides_trans with (b:=power x (q*n)).
  + exact Hdiv.
  + apply power_divides_lemma1. apply Nat.lt_0_succ.
Qed.
Qed.```

original: intros p n q x Hprime Hdiv Hn. apply gauss with (a:=power x n). - apply rel_prime_power with (n:=q*n) in Hprime. apply power_rel_prime. + apply Nat.lt_0_succ. + apply Hprime. - apply divides_trans with (b:=power x (q*n)). + apply Hdiv. + apply power_divides_lemma1. apply Nat.lt_0_succ.
